messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] hunters
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/2/2003 9:07:11 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... There are a few rotten eggs on both sides yes. ... In my next of the woods they seem to be.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/2/2003 9:07:11 AM Eastern Standard Time,
abtleo@... writes:
>
>
> >>>And my point is that most non hunters don't do those things, either.
> There
> are a few bad eggs. But you phrased it as though there are a few good eggs,
> but most are rotton. I'm suspicious that there are rotton eggs on both,
> with the majority being good>>>


There are a few "rotten" eggs on both sides yes.
> OK, That I can agree with.



> >>>>brenda
> who still wants to believe that most people are good, so if it's not true,
> don't tell me.>>>>>>>
>
In my next of the woods they seem to be.

Laura D




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] hunters
messages.msgSnippet: ... I m sorry that wasn t clear to me.  You said for the most part in ... And my point is that most non hunters don t do those things, either.  There are a
messages.messageBody:
6/2/03 00:55:

> That why I said "for the most part." I know there are bad eggs out there as
> there is in any situation.

I'm sorry that wasn't clear to me. You said "for the most part" in
reference to the hunters part. I objected based on the second sentence:

>> It is non hunters that litter, cut
>>down trees and do cruel things to animals.

And my point is that most non hunters don't do those things, either. There
are a few bad eggs. But you phrased it as though there are a few good eggs,
but most are rotton. I'm suspicious that there are rotton eggs on both,
with the majority being good.

brenda
who still wants to believe that most people are good, so if it's not true,
don't tell me.
